SENT.plain: Aneurysms arising from a lenticulostriate artery (LSA) are uncommon
Their causes include hypertension, moyamoya disease, infection, systemic lupus erythematosis, and flow-related saccular aneurysms
Options for treating these aneurysms are limited

The authors present a case in which an LSA aneurysm was identified in a 69-year-old woman with no significant medical history, who experienced a sudden onset of right hemiparesis and aphasia due to a basal ganglia hemorrhage
The different causes and treatment options available for these rare and difficult-to-treat aneurysms are discussed
